comments.body: Here is a `customCoordinates` that is a string and not null. Need to verify to check if it can't also be `null`, but this situation can bring confusion as it should be a `CustomCoordinate` type.

That's why I introduced the customCoordinatesResponse type, as only the response can be null.
I've tested it and it breaks when I pass `customCoordinates: null` within the upload function.

And yes, maybe we should do the same for tags as it has same behavior.
I know it's not ideal but it's how their api works unfortunately.

@romdim ok, that makes sense. I still think we should replace "response" in CustomCoordinateResponse with something else so people don't confuse it with an actual response.

Also for ListFileResponse, I don't see the createdAt property in the docs?
https://docs.imagekit.io/api-reference/media-api/list-and-search-files#response-structure-and-status-code-application-json

Did you test it and notice it existed ? If so should probably tell them to update their documentation.

For the ListFileResponse indeed, I saw it through testing even though they don't have it in their docs and it's my To-do's to tell them about it.

For the customCoordinates, what about NullableCustomCoordinates then?
Otherwise I can just remove the type altogether and use the null wherever needed and that's that.
Either is fine by me!
